entries.npc_reset_2: Why can you not take care of this simple task? Really, you vex me, you really do.
entries.player_sorry_2: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_reset_2: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.waypoint_description_2: This former paramour of philosopher Bieque Lozan-Lippid is awaiting an invitation to
from the Restuss socialite Indintra Imbru Yerevan.
entries.waypoint_description_1: This friend of Restuss socialite Indintra Imbru Yerevan is expecting a request from Indintra Imbru Yerevan to invite scholar Ingon Lakbo to a dinner party and thus divert him away from the
entries.player_sorry_1: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_reset_1: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_more_1_2: Why is it important to you that Bieque Lozan-Lippid is attending?
entries.player_3_2: How will this invitation counter the philosopher's influence in the debate?
entries.player_3_1: you're making that might lure Lakbo away?
entries.npc_work_2: I wish you'd deliver that invitation to Shaultra. Time is short.
entries.npc_work_1: Really, I've told you enough already. Please deliver my little suggestion to Briska Gil.
entries.npc_smuggle_2: Well, if Bieque Lozan-Lippid will be at the
debate, I certainly will attend. I have much to address with Bieque.
entries.npc_smuggle_1: Hmm -- Ingon is such a talker; he really is rather tedious at the dining table. But I suppose I should aid Indintra -- she'll owe me dearly for this one. Now let me see about assembling a suitable guest list for this party... (*Briska's voice fades while mumbling what sounds like a list of names*).
entries.npc_reward_2: Splendid. I can hardly wait to see the look of appalled affront on Bieque's face when he sees his paramour at the debate. He won't retain the intellectual capacity of a frightened borgle.
entries.npc_reward_1: I'm so glad you delivered that invitation. Here, take some money. I have another little job for you, if you want it.
entries.npc_reset_1: Why can you not take care of this simple task? Really, you vex me, you really do.
entries.npc_noloc_2: I'm waiting for Shaultra to arrange a suitable rendezvous for the delivery. Talk to me again in a moment.
entries.npc_noloc_1: Fine, fine. I'm waiting for Briska Gil to assent to my suggestion for rendezvous coordinates. Talk to me again in a few moments.
entries.npc_more_2_2: Bieque has notions about the nature of identity and reality that are, to my mind, unsustainable by a more insightful intellect. I imagine that my pointed deflation of his absurd notion will raise his blood pressure.
entries.npc_more_1_2: Bieque and I had a romantic relationship, but we parted in heated argument about the immanence of evil. I still resent his acidic innuendo regarding my intellectual capacity. I look forward to the chance to correct him at the debate.
entries.npc_failure_2: You couldn't deliver that simple invitation? How very vexing you are.
entries.npc_failure_1: You could not deliver a simple suggestion? Really, you vex me beyond words.
entries.npc_breech_2: Hello! Do you have an invitation for me from Indintra Yerevan?
entries.npc_breech_1: Hello? Did Indintra Yerevan send you?
entries.npc_backtowork_2: Really, I've told you all you need to know. I wish you'd deliver that invitation to Shaultra.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: I would have hoped you'd deliver that suggestion to Briska Gil by now.
entries.npc_5_2: Restuss and Narmle, which are what I suppose you'd call friendly rivals, hold debates every so often between the cities' finest minds. Victory for Restuss will prove our superiority over that rabble in Narmle.
entries.npc_5_1: Restuss and Narmle, which are what I suppose you'd call friendly rivals, hold debates every so often between the cities' finest minds. Victory for Restuss will prove our superiority over that rabble in Narmle.
entries.npc_4_2: I am inviting Bieque Lozan-Lippid's former paramour, Shaultra Loraweet, to take part in the debate on behalf of Restuss. Shaultra and Bieque parted on bad terms, and I expect her presence will cause Bieque much distraction. In the best case, he might even make a scene and be summarily ejected. Will you deliver this invitation to Shaultra?
entries.npc_4_1: Honestly, it's quite innocent -- I'm simply suggesting to a friend we hold in common, Briska Gil, that Briska could invite Ingon Lakbo to a must-attend dinner party coinciding with the debate. Ingon is hardly the ideal dinner guest -- always pontificating about
-- but it would be a sacrifice in a good cause. Will you deliver my innocent suggestion?
entries.npc_3_2: After you proved so helpful before, I expected more of you. Goodbye.
entries.npc_3_1: Well, what a vexing figure you are then. Goodbye.
entries.npc_2_2: Fine. Deliver this invitation into Shaultra Loraweet's hands, and on no account be distracted by any pesky protocol droids.
entries.npc_2_1: I knew you'd help. You must deliver this into the hands of Briska Gil, my dear friend and a close acquaintance of Ingon Lakbo. Now don't be giving it to any foolish protocol droid, but to Briska in person!
entries.npc_1_2: My plans are proceeding nicely for the next

debate. Now that Ingon Lakbo has declined to support that rabble in Narmle, I expect their next choice will be a philosopher named Bieque Lozan-Lippid. I believe I can counter his influence with your help. Will you deliver this invitation?
entries.npc_1_1: Darling, everyone who is anyone will be attending the next

debate -- including, I'm told, that nasty Narmle scholar Ingon Lakbo. His attendance would be disastrous, simply disastrous. Would you kindly deliver this suggestion to a dear friend that might lure Mr. Lakbo away from the debate?
entries.notyet: Too busy to talk now.  Try me again later.
entries.next: I'm happy to say that all our preparations for the Great Conversation debate are gelling nicely. I need nothing from you right now.
entries.gotowork_2: I expected you to bring me an invitation from Indintra Imbru Yerevan to the
entries.gotowork_1: I expected you to bring me a suggestion of some kind from Indintra Imbru Yerevan. Don't you have it?
entries.dontknowyou_2: I'm afraid you have the wrong person.
entries.dontknowyou_1: I'm sorry, you have the wrong person.
entries.cant_work: Oh dear. I'd planned to offer you a small job, but I see you're busy. How vexing.
